dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C2872411I] Website/Forum closure request
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright. Legal Response Team THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. -----Original Message----- From: abuse@ev1servers.net [mailto:abuse@ev1servers.net] Sent: Friday, February 02, 2007 10:15 AM To: Copyright Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C2872411I] Website/Forum closure request ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Website/Forum closure request Added by system at Friday, Feb 2 2007 08:14 am X-MailFrom: Satoru.Hamada@vgames.net X-RcptTo: abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [70.87.6.111] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Fri Feb 2 08:14:14 2007 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Fri, 2 Feb 2007 08:13:27 -0600 Return-path: Delivery-date: Fri, 02 Feb 2007 08:13:27 -0600 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from Satoru.Hamada@vgames.net) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1HCzAN-00004Y-Ih for Abuse@theplanet.com; Fri, 02 Feb 2007 08:13:27 -0600 Received: from smtp2.vu-games.com ([195.68.73.199]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from Satoru.Hamada@vgames.net) with esmtp (Exim) id 1HCzAI-00091h-SI for Abuse@theplanet.com; Fri, 02 Feb 2007 08:13:23 -0600 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.0.6603.0 content-class: urn:content-classes:message Return-Receipt-To: "Satoru Hamada" MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C746D3.FBFFA882" Disposition-Notification-To: "Satoru Hamada" Subject: Website/Forum closure request Date: Fri, 2 Feb 2007 15:11:08 +0100 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Website/Forum closure request Thread-Index: AcdG0/wImovlcLvlRKOGLc56VbOFHQ== From: "Satoru Hamada" To: X-OriginalArrivalTime: 02 Feb 2007 14:13:27.0913 (UTC) FILETIME=[4F336D90:01C746D4] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) Dear Sir, Madam, Our Company, Vivendi Games Europe, a reputed computer software editor, is editing the massively multiplayer online role playing game (MMORPG) World of Warcraft. In order to play our game on authorized servers, users have to create an account and connect through the official identification platform. Our customers support team has detected that a person is offering access to unauthorized servers, in breach of our Terms of Service and End-User License Agreement . According to our teams' investigation, the person offering this service is using an online interface, designed like the official homepage of the game (copyrighted www.wow-europe.com ), available at the following website address: http://www.jesterswow.nl.tt/ ; this website also offers a forum available at http://jester.forumup.nl/ , reproducing without any authorisation our official forum design, and appears to be hosted by your services. By hosting this webpage, you provide this scammer a tool to: - violate our Terms of Use, - reproduce illicitly our copyrighted material, - infringe our intellectual property rights on logos, trademarks and website design, For that reason, we inform you that the content of such website is illicit and that this activity is causing a great trouble to our service; we therefore ask you to: 1. cease the hosting of the said website, and prevent any user to access this website; And 2. Transmit us any relevant information related to the identification of person who manages the said website, in order for us to investigate further. Should you fail to comply with this request, we will institute legal proceedings. Sincerely, Satoru Hamada Vivendi Games Europe Legal Department MIME element (text/html)

Dear Sir, Madam,

 

 

Our Company, Vivendi Games Europe, a reputed computer software editor, is editing the massively multiplayer online role playing game (MMORPG) World of Warcraft.

 

In order to play our game on authorized servers, users have to create an account and connect through the official identification platform.

 

Our customers support team has detected that a person is offering access to unauthorized servers, in breach of our Terms of Service and End-User License Agreement.

According to our teams’ investigation, the person offering this service is using an online interface, designed like the official homepage of the game (copyrighted www.wow-europe.com), available at the following website address: http://www.jesterswow.nl.tt/ ; this website also offers a forum available at http://jester.forumup.nl/ , reproducing without any authorisation our official forum  design, and appears to be hosted by your services. By hosting this webpage, you provide this scammer a tool to:

-           violate our Terms of Use,

-           reproduce illicitly our copyrighted material,

-           infringe our intellectual property rights on logos, trademarks and website design,

 

For that reason, we inform you that the content of such website is illicit and that this activity is causing a great trouble to our service; we therefore ask you to:

 

1.      cease the hosting of the said website, and prevent any user to access this website;

 

And

 

2.      Transmit us any relevant information related to the identification of person who manages the said website, in order for us to investigate further.

 

 

Should you fail to comply with this request, we will institute legal proceedings.

 

Sincerely,

 

 

Satoru Hamada

Vivendi Games Europe

Legal Department

 

 

MIME element (text/plain)
